sec.div: Gas chromatography/mass spectrometry analysis of essential oil
sec.p: Yellow-colored essential oil (yield 1.6% v/w) was obtained by hydrodistillation method and analyzed using GC/MS. Table 1 shows the obtained results by the GC/MS analysis of C. zeylanicum essential oil. Thirteen compounds were identified, which represented 98.93% of the total oil. The main components were cinnamaldehyde (91.8%), ρ-metoxicinamate (1.57%), and α-pinene (1.25%).

div.p: Essential oil composition of Cinnamomum zeylanicum identified by gas chromatography/mass spectroscopy

sec.p: Table 2 shows the scolicidal effects of C. zeylanicum essential oil with different concentrations following various exposure times. C. zeylanicum essential oil with the concentrations of 100 and 50 μL/mL killed 100% of protoscoleces after 5 min of exposure. Likewise, the mean mortality rate of protoscoleces with the concentration of 25 μL/mL was 100% after 10 min of incubation. However, lower concentrations showed moderate protoscolicidal effects so that, at the concentration of 12.5 μL/mL, 36.6, 74.3, 100, and 100% of protoscoleces and, at the concentration of 6.25 μL/mL, 16.6, 43, 82.3, and 100% of protoscoleces were killed after 5, 10, 20, and 30 min of incubation, respectively. However, the mortality rate of protoscoleces in the negative and positive controls was 4.3% after 30 min and 100% after 5 min of exposure, respectively. Therefore, the obtained findings demonstrated that the essential oil of C. zeylanicum at all of these concentrations had more significant ( P < 0.05) scolicidal effects than the control group.

div.p: Scolicidal effects of Cinnamomum zeylanicum essential oil against protoscoleces of hydatid cyst at various concentrations following various exposure times

sec.p: Acute toxicity effects of C. zeylanicum essential oil on male NMRI mice were determined. The LD 50 value of intraperitoneal injection of C. zeylanicum essential oil was 2.07 mL/kg body weight after 24 h, and the maximum nonfatal dose was 1.52 mL/kg body weight.

In the present study and according to the results of LD 50, the doses of 0.05, 0.1, and 0.4 ml/kg of C. zeylanicum essential oil were selected. The obtained findings indicated that no death was observed in doses of 0.05, 0.1, and 0.2 ml/kg after 2 weeks. Tables 3 and 4 are shown the results of the clinical chemistry and hematological parameters following oral administration of C. zeylanicum essential oil for 2 weeks. There was no significant difference ( P > 0.05) between oral administrations of C. zeylanicum essential oil at the doses 0.05, 0.1, and 0.4 mL/kg and control.

div.p: Clinical chemistry parameters in mice sera following oral administration of Cinnamomum zeylanicum essential oil for 2 weeks
Hematology parameters in whole blood of mice following oral administration of Cinnamomum zeylanicum essential oil for 2 weeks
